title: Glossary
summary: Comprehensive sustainability glossary providing definitions of key terms used in environmental, social, and governance (ESG) contexts, organized alphabetically with practical explanations.
purpose: To provide brief definitions of the main terms used in sustainability, helping users understand differences and similarities between concepts
disclaimer: Many sustainability concepts lack commonly accepted international definitions, leading to dozens of similar or contradictory definitions

major_concepts.3Rs: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle - hierarchy for better resource management
major_concepts.Carbon_Footprint: Total amount of GHG including CO2 and methane produced by individuals/organizations/products
major_concepts.Carbon_Neutral: State where GHG released equals amount removed/reduced
major_concepts.Circular_Economy: Closed-loop system: make, use, reuse, remake, recycle based on Ellen MacArthur Foundation principles
major_concepts.ESG: Environmental, Social and Governance factors for evaluating corporate sustainability
major_concepts.Net_Zero: Balance between GHG produced and removed from atmosphere
major_concepts.Scope_1_2_3: Three categories of GHG emissions defined by GHG Protocol
major_concepts.Science_Based_Targets: Emission reduction targets aligned with Paris Agreement goals
major_concepts.Zero_Waste: Waste prevention principles focused on responsible production/consumption

reporting_frameworks: TCFD - Task force on Climate-related Financial Disclosure
singapore_specific: ACRA - Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority
Green Mark Certification - Building rating system
certification_systems: CEMARS - Certified Emissions Measurement And Reduction Scheme
LEED - Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design
Green Mark - Singapore green building rating
financial_instruments: Green Bonds - Fixed-income for environmental projects
Carbon Credits - Electronic units representing CO2 reduction
climate_science: IPCC - Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change
business_concepts: Servitization - Shift from products to services
Internal Carbon Price - Monetary value per tonne CO2
Materiality - Identifying most relevant ESG factors
cross_references: Links to related TMI pages for deeper understanding
target_audience: Businesses and individuals seeking sustainability literacy
